snippet: The Cuban government has twice before released prisoners before a papal visit, measures meant to elicit good will for the state.
abstract: Cuban government plans to release more than 3,000 prisoners from its jails before upcoming visit by Pope Francis; human rights advocates applaud gesture but point out release is unlikely to signal any significant change in Cuban policies toward dissidents; records show that even as high-profile releases begin, opponents of Castro government continue to be detained.

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and FRANCES ROBLES

lead_paragraph: The Cuban government has twice before released prisoners before a papal visit, measures meant to elicit good will for the state.

headline.main: Cuba to Release 3,522 Prisoners Before Pope Francis’ Visit
headline.print_headline: Cuba to Release Prisoners Before Pope Francis’ Visit

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
